title: Opening by European Commission and European Parliament
description: Video

title: Panel 1: Workplace of the future
description: Conceiving the workplace of the future is instrumental to the way of working in the European institutions and their future development. Join the debate on:
What does a human-centred digital workplace look like?
What type of organisation knowledge workers want and how can IT solutions enable it?
What culture for the workplace of the future?

title: Panel 2: Digital democracy
description: Digital platforms are bringing about a new level of interaction between government and citizens and between IT services and customers. Take part in the debate on:
How to reach a new generation of connected audiences?
How to know your audience and respond better to its needs?
How to design a better digital delivery of services?

title: Discussions
description: Open PM2 initiative
How to stimulate innovation at the EP

title: Panel 3: Technologies of the future
description: Today's world is marked by increasingly sophisticated technologies and fast-evolving trends, such as the rise of big data, the cloud, mobile devices and collaborative working. The right balance between consumers' expectations and the impact of change management combined with security and corporate constraints will have to be defined. Join the debate on:
How the Internet is evolving and what does it mean for our identity, privacy and jobs skills?
What are the challenges for large organisations?
How can they respond to these changes and stay relevant?

title: Building a user experience design culture
description: There is a lot of confusion about what user experience is and what it encompasses. In this workshop you will discover that user experience is much more than a designers job. That everybody can affect the experience of citizens no matter their role.
UX consultant Paul Boag will introduce you to ways you can better understand our users. He will also teach you how to identify the problem areas in the users experience.
By the end of the session you will be ready to start undertaking user research. Ready to start improving the user's experience.

title: Knowledge worker: culture, skills, tools
description: This participatory session will look into how knowledge workers thrive and bring value, energising and motivating the teams around them. What skills do they have? What else do they need to perform better? How we can change the culture and environment to have even more synergies and collaboration in a knowledge-driven organisation?
Video

title: Open Source: the future for the European institutions
description: Slides

title: Panel 4: Technologies of the future (continued)
description: Today's world is marked by increasingly sophisticated technologies and fast-evolving trends, such as the rise of big data, the cloud, mobile devices and collaborative working. The right balance between consumers' expectations and the impact of change management combined with security and corporate constraints will have to be defined. Take part in the debate on:
What are the lessons learned from private and public cloud adoption?
What exactly is big data and how big is it?
How are we using these new technological tools, how we will be using them in the future and what impacts will that have?

title: Open data and digitalisation for public administrations
description: In this session, the debate will look deeper into the notions of open data, net neutrality and digitalisation to examine how these actually impact our democracies and what effects they are having and may have in public administrations. We will focus on issues, such as:
- What digital and open data approaches are there for public administration processes?
- How important is net neutrality in this context?
- What should be the role of ICT in the workings of the public sector?
- How can new technology make a positive difference in public administrations and service delivery?
Slides
Download Mercedes Fuertes' slides
Download Diana Urania Galetta's slides
Download Maive Rute's slides
Video

title: InterHack experience
description: The first inter-institutional hackathon brought together IT professionals from the European Parliament, the European Commission and the Council of the EU in October. The results and lessons learned from the collaboration will be presented in this session.
Video

title: Encryption: blessing or curse for IT security
description: Encryption plays a crucial role in securing information systems and the business data they contain. External communications are routinely encrypted and network traffic inside an organisation is increasingly encrypted to reduce the risk that attackers that can get access to an organisation's vital information. Increasingly it is standard practice that information is encrypted for storage.

But encryption can also be exploited by attackers. Malware can be hidden inside incoming encrypted communications so as to avoid antivirus scanning and to cover the exfiltration of sensitive information from data loss prevention systems. IT security defenders are looking for ways to look inside such traffic to protect the organisation.
What are the legally sound, organisationally proportionate and technically effective measures that can be used to protect business systems against the misuse of encryption? This session will examine:
• The risks associated with the use of encryption in an organisation
• Technical options for defence against misuse of encryption
• The organisational policy and legal issues associated
Video

title: Special guest: Vincent Bruneau, CEO of Magency
